Class Stay

  • java.lang.Object
    • Stay

  • public class Stay
extends java.lang.Object
    The class Stay has the responsibility of defining and storing hotel stays.
    Since:
    2016-11-10

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stay(Reservation reservation)
      Constructor for creating objects of type Stay.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(Stay stay)
      This method compares if two stays come from the same reservation(Note: if they come from the same reservation the other data fields will be equal due to restrictions put on check in and check out times).
      Date getCheckInDate()
      This method returns the check in date.
      Date getCheckOutDate()
      This method returns the date the customer leaves the hotel.
      double getCost()
      This method returns the cost of the stay.
      java.lang.String getFirstRoomType()
      This method returns the type of room the customer stayed in.
      int getNumberOfRooms()
      This method returns the number of rooms reserved for a stay.
      Reservation getReservation()
      This method returns the reservation that the stay is based on.
      void setCheckInDate(Date todaysDate)
      This method sets the date that the customer checked in.
      void setCheckOutDate(Date expectedCheckoutDate)
      This method sets the checkOutDate of the stay.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a string representing the stay(compatable for csv use).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

      • Stay

        public Stay(Reservation reservation)
        Constructor for creating objects of type Stay.
        Parameters:
        reservation - The reservation that preceded the stay (customer reserves room(s) then checks in to create a stay).

        public void setCheckInDate(Date todaysDate)
        This method sets the date that the customer checked in.
        Parameters:
        todaysDate - Todays date (are you aware it is the current day?).

      • setCheckOutDate

        public void setCheckOutDate(Date expectedCheckoutDate)
        This method sets the checkOutDate of the stay.
        Parameters:
        expectedCheckoutDate - The date we expected the customer to check out (we can presume a customer will when they're expected to).

        Returns:

      • getCost

        This method returns the cost of the stay.

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Stay stay)
        This method compares if two stays come from the same reservation(Note: if they come from the same reservation the other data fields will be equal due to restrictions put on check in and check out times).
        Parameters:
        stay - The stay we are comparing with
        Returns:
        The truth value of whether or not the two stays come from the same reservation.
